reporter_caption.center: IN RE MARRIAGE OF HAWKINS, 823 S.W.2d 27 (Mo.App.E.D. 1991)

caption.center: IN RE THE MARRIAGE OF NORMA M. HAWKINS, APPELLANT/CROSS-RESPONDENT, v.

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT OF ST. LOUIS COUNTY; B.C. DRUMM, JR., JUDGE.
opinion.attorneys:
Mason W. Klippel, Clayton, for appellant/cross-respondent.
David E. Wilson, Clayton, for respondent/cross-appellant.
opinion.opinion_text:
[1] Husband and wife both appeal from the trial court's judgment in a dissolution decree. The trial court's judgment is supported by substantial evidence and is not against the weight of the evidence. No error of law appears. Murphy v. Carron, 536 S.W.2d 30 (Mo. banc 1976).
[2] An opinion reciting the detailed facts and restating the principles of law would have no precedential value. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum opinion for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.
[3] The judgment is affirmed in accordance with Rule 84.16(b).
